tool.name: minipileup
tool.command:
#if str($reference_source.reference_source_selector) == 'history': #set $reference_fasta_fn = 'reference.fa' ln -s '$reference_source.f' $reference_fasta_fn && samtools faidx $reference_fasta_fn 2>&1 || echo "Error running samtools faidx for indexing fasta reference for minipileup" >&2 && #else #set $reference_fasta_fn = str($reference_source.f.fields.path) #end if minipileup -f $reference_fasta_fn ${general.y} ${general.v} ${general.c} ${general.C} ${a_filter.P} #if str($a_filter.q): -q '${a_filter.q}' #end if #if str($a_filter.l): -l '${a_filter.l}' #end if #if str($a_filter.q): -S '${a_filter.S}' #end if #if str($s_filter.Q): -Q '${s_filter.Q}' #end if #if str($s_filter.T): -T '${s_filter.T}' #end if #if str($s_filter.s): -s '${s_filter.s}' #end if #if str($s_filter.a): -a '${s_filter.a}' #end if #if str($s_filter.p): -p '${s_filter.p}' #end if
'$bam' > '$variants'

param.name: reference_source_selector
param.label: Choose the source for the reference genome
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options. See `Indexes` section of help below. If you would like to perform self-mapping select `history` here, then choose your input file as reference.

validator.message: A built-in reference genome is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.name: f
param.label: Use the following dataset as the reference sequence
param.help: You can upload a FASTA or FASTQ sequence to the history and use it as reference

param.name: v
param.label: Show variants only
param.help: Only changed sites will be shown if Yes

param.name: c
param.label: Output VCF format
param.help: Output will be formatted as a VCF file

param.name: C
param.label: Show count of alleles of both strands

section.name: a_filter
section.title: Alignment filters
section.help: Filters related to alignment between reads and reference

param.name: P
param.label: Only consider properly paired reads
param.help: Only calls variants in properly paired reads

param.name: q
param.label: Set minimum mapping quality
param.help: Reads with mapping quality below this value will not be included

param.name: l
param.label: Set minimum alignment length
param.help: Reads aligningfor less than this many bases will not be considered

param.name: S
param.label: Set minimum supplementary alignment length
param.help: Similar to above but for supplemental alignments

param.name: Q
param.label: Set minimum base quality
param.help: Bases with quality below this value will not be included

param.name: T
param.label: Skip bases within that distance from both ends of the read
param.help: Useful when quality drops towards ends

param.name: s
param.label: Drop alleles below this depth
param.help: Do not call variants supported by less than this number of reads

param.name: a
param.label: Drop alleles below this depth on either strand

param.name: p
param.label: Drop allele if its faction less than

tool.help: Usage: minipileup [options] in1.bam [in2.bam [...]] Options: General: -f FILE reference genome [null] -v show variants only -c output in the VCF format (force -v) -C show count of each allele on both strands -e use '*' to mark deleted bases -y variant calling mode (-vcC -a2 -s5 -q30 -Q20) -V print version number Alignment filter: -r STR region in format of 'ctg:start-end' [null] -b FILE BED or position list file to include [null] -P only consider properly paired reads for paired-end reads -q INT minimum mapping quality [0] -l INT minimum alignment length [0] -S INT minimum supplementary alignment length [0] Site filter: -Q INT minimum base quality [0] -T INT skip bases within INT-bp from either end of a read [0] -s INT drop alleles with depth<INT [1] -a INT drop alleles with depth<INT on either strand [0] -p FLOAT drop an allele if the allele fraction is below FLOAT [0]
